event.title: were established in the early 1770s in the vicinity of what is now

data.event: Washington County is rooted in the Watauga settlements, which were established in the early 1770s in the vicinity of what is now Elizabethton, in adjacent Carter County.

event.title: the outbreak of the Revolutionary War in 1776

data.event: At the outbreak of the Revolutionary War in 1776, the Wataugans organized the "Washington District," which was governed by a committee of safety.

event.title: included all of what is now

data.event: The settlements were governed as the Washington District, which originally included all of what is now Tennessee.

event.title: was reorganized as Washington County in 1777

data.event: The district was reorganized as Washington County in 1777.
